MV_Lazio.title: MV Lazio
MV_Lazio.first_paragraph:
Two ships of Tirrenia di Navigazione have been named Lazio:MV Lazio (1953), in service 1953–67
MV Lazio (1993), in service since 1994

linked_pages.title: MV Avrasya
linked_pages.first_paragraph: Avrasya was a Ro-Ro ferry that was hijacked in the Black Sea hostage crisis of 1996. Originally built in 1953 as the passenger ship Lazio, she was converted to a Ro-Ro ferry in 1967. In 1979, she was sold to Greece and renamed Sant Andrea. A sale in 1984 saw her renamed Makedonia, followed by a chartering in 1985 which saw her renamed Summer Star. A sale in 1986 saw her renamed Corfu Diamond and after a further sale in 1988 she was renamed Larnaca Rose. In 1992, she was sold to Panama and was renamed Avrasya. Following the hijacking incident, she was renamed Cortina, then Avrasya I in 1997. She was sold for scrapping in November 1997.

linked_pages.title: Tirrenia (company)
linked_pages.first_paragraph: Tirrenia di Navigazione or Tirrenia of Navigations, was an Italian state-owned shipping company.

what_links_here.title: Lazio (disambiguation)
what_links_here.first_paragraph: Lazio is a region of Italy in which Rome is located.
